articles.title: Japan’s PM ‘will not tolerate’ Assassin’s Creed cultural disrespect of shrine - This Week In Asia
articles.description: Japan’s PM criticised Assassin’s Creed: Shadows for cultural disrespect, sparking debate on historical accuracy and the game’s portrayal of shrines.
articles.content: The release of the latest video game in the blockbuster Assassins Creed series has ignited controversy in Japan, prompting Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba to assert that the country will not tolerate a… [+1111 chars]
